intro: Dorstenia cuspidata var. suarezensis, commonly known as the Suarensis False Banana, is a unique species native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiral-arranged leaves that form a rosette. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical study and conservation efforts.
